Might this be an eclipse bug and how do I figure that out?

The wierd thing is that everything seemed to be working just fine this morning ...

Regards.
as I see from your notes the dependencies you use are differet from what we published in PDT 1.0. please use our dependencies. and verify it works.

Created an attachment (id=78877)
Log file of the exception in pdt-all-in-one

I have the same problem with the all-in-one incubation (only added the aforementioned mylyn 2.1M1 and RSE maintenance build as extra plugins however the workspace I tested on does not make use of those atm).

I've attached the .log file

I was able to recreate the problem from scratch with the all in one, no extra plugins and a new workspace. I created a new folder linked to the one on the filesystem that contains my files and still got the code completion problems.

The weird thing is that eclipse also started nagging about wanting more memory.

It seems like there is something in my files that something in eclipse (whether it is PDT or WST) chokes on. I don't however have a clue what it might be :\.

If there's a way by which I can somehow supply more debug information let me know.

Regards.

Created an attachment (id=78878)
Log file of a fresh workspace generating the error(s)

Sorry for the mail spam you are probably now receiving Guy. However I figured out the cause of the problem :).

I am currently in the process of rewriting some code and due to that the class I was working in had two functions that shared the same name (one of them is to be removed once rewriting is complete). After I changed the name of one of them code completion started working again and the errors were gone.

I was able to reproduce the problem (though with a bit different errors) when creating a new PHP project > new PHP file and writing a class that has two functions with an identical name.

Attached is the log file of wat happened with my fresh workspace.

since no comment has been added by the reporter i guess his problem is solved
also running the case Guy published works fine - therefore closing this bug
